<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - Here are the song suggestions for Sunday.  As it is the 3rd Sunday of the month, we will have rehearsal immediately following service.  We will be rehearsing a new song (H564 Come as a child) to sing for the Celia&#39;s baptism next Sunday.<br clear="all"></div><div><br></div><div>Thanks, so much for all you do!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></div></div></div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - </div><div><br></div><div>Here are the song suggestions for tomorrow.  It is the first Sunday of the month, so we will be having rehearsal immediately following service.</div><div><br></div><div>Also - a reminder that our (April!) monthly rehearsal with Noel is this Friday - 6 May at 7:00 pm.</div><div><br></div><div>I hope you are all having an amazing day enjoying the beautiful weather!</div><div><br></div><div>Barb<br clear="all"></div><div><br></div><div><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"> </span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font></td><td width="250" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:187.6pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font></td></tr></tbody></table><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</font></div><div><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

  </font></td><td width="58" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:43.5pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font></td><td width="250" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:187.6pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><b><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold">When</span></font></b></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

<div dir="ltr">Hi All - Sorry I have not gotten back to you.  Our sopranos will be absent tomorrow!  So - if it will work out for you to come early, at 9:40 to practice, we can see how it goes with me and/or Betsy on soprano.  If you cannot make it, or it doesn&#39;t work out, I have another song that the choir can sing after the text (#8 in the choir book - verse 2 of Give me a heart like Thine).  Please reply to all to confirm that you got this message and whether or not it will work out for you.  Thanks, so much for your understanding and flexibility!  Barb</div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Mon, Apr 4, 2016 at 11:35 PM, Barb Schenk <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com" target="_blank">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - </div><div><br></div><div>I hope you&#39;re having a wonderful week. <div class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:12.0pt"><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br>

 ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br>

<br>

HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br>

<br>

&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br>

 ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br>

</font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

2016</div><div><br></div><div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - <br><br>I&#39;m so sorry that the flu has taken it&#39;s toll in White Plains.  I hope everyone is feeling better soon!<br><br></div>With all the sickness, the Good Friday song list ended up with last-minute-revamping.  We did more congregational singing and did NOT sing Mozart&#39;s Ave Verum Corpus.<br><br>If it works out, and everyone is healthy and feels up to it, we will sing the Mozart tomorrow for Easter for repentance.  Please note, this is NOT a call for anyone to overextend themselves or hurt their voice or to try anything super-heroic!  If it works out - that&#39;s a wonderful thing.  If it does not work out, then we will sing it in the next couple of weeks - the 3rd or 10th of April.  <br><br>Everyone - choir and organists alike - worked very, very hard on the Passion Week songs.  And we sound very, very good.  It can be disappointing when we&#39;ve worked so hard on something and circumstances and plans change.  I want to assure everyone that we WILL sing the Mozart, either tomorrow or in the next few weeks when it works out for everyone.  None of our rehearsing is in vain, as we carry all our learning through to every song that we sing.<br><div class="gmail_extra"><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">And one more reminder - that EVERYONE is invited to sing in the choir - whether it&#39;s once a month or once a year or every service!<br><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Thanks, so much, for all you do!  Stay healthy!  💒<br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Barb<br></div><div <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</font></span></div>
</blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></div>

</div></blockquote></div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - <br><br>I&#39;m so sorry that the flu has taken it&#39;s toll in White Plains.  I hope everyone is feeling better soon!<br><br></div>With all the sickness, the Good Friday song list ended up with last-minute-revamping.  We did more congregational singing and did NOT sing Mozart&#39;s Ave Verum Corpus.<br><br>If it works out, and everyone is healthy and feels up to it, we will sing the Mozart tomorrow for Easter for repentance.  Please note, this is NOT a call for anyone to overextend themselves or hurt their voice or to try anything super-heroic!  If it works out - that&#39;s a wonderful thing.  If it does not work out, then we will sing it in the next couple of weeks - the 3rd or 10th of April.  <br><br>Everyone - choir and organists alike - worked very, very hard on the Passion Week songs.  And we sound very, very good.  It can be disappointing when we&#39;ve worked so hard on something and circumstances and plans change.  I want to assure everyone that we WILL sing the Mozart, either tomorrow or in the next few weeks when it works out for everyone.  None of our rehearsing is in vain, as we carry all our learning through to every song that we sing.<br><div class="gmail_extra"><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">And one more reminder - that EVERYONE is invited to sing in the choir - whether it&#39;s once a month or once a year or every service!<br><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Thanks, so much, for all you do!  Stay healthy!  💒<br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Barb<br></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Thu, Mar 24, 2016 at 1:03 AM, Barb Schenk <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com" target="_blank">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - Here are the song suggestions for Easter Sunday.  They have not changed since being sent out on 6 March.  Please take a few moments to review any songs that were not rehearsed on Saturday or Sunday.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks, so much.  Have an amazing rest of the week!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div><div><br></div><div><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3"></font><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3"> I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. </blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<p>hi jon!  soooooo very sorry that you&#39;re not feeling well!  thanks for letting me know. it appears that most of the choir has been hit!  pr henkel, jason, dorothea, you. I doubt that we will be singing ave verum corpus. I will likely switch many of the songs out and do more congregational songs.  hope you feel better!  barb</p>
<div class="gmail_quote">On Mar 25, 2016 5:04 PM, &quot;Jonathan White&quot; &lt;<a href="mailto:jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com">jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com</a>&gt; wrote:<br type="attribution"><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex">Dear Barb,<br>
<br>
Unfortunately, I&#39;ve been sick all week. It started with a headache and chills and a sore throat, and now I have sneezing, a runny nose, and a deep cough. I will most likely be in and out of the Mother&#39;s Room, but I won&#39;t be able to sing.  I&#39;m very sorry to miss singing Ave Verum Corpus. I had been hoping I&#39;d feel better all week, and while I&#39;m feeling better than Monday and Tuesday, I still won&#39;t be able to sing.<br>
<br>
See you tonight (though I won&#39;t be shaking hands)!<br>
~Jon<br>

<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - Here are the song suggestions for Easter Sunday.  They have not changed since being sent out on 6 March.  Please take a few moments to review any songs that were not rehearsed on Saturday or Sunday.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks, so much.  Have an amazing rest of the week!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div><div><br></div><div><font color="#000000" I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

</font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"><font color="#000000">Hi
All – Sorry for the length of the message.  Just a reminder that we have rehearsal with Noel <b><span style="font-weight:bold">TOMORROW –
Saturday 19 March – at 6pm</span></b></font><font color="#000000">.</font><span><font color="#000000"> 
</font></span><font color="#000000">We will be practicing the songs for Passion week.</font><span><font color="#000000">  </font></span><font color="#000000">There are a number of songs we haven’t sung
in a while.</font><span><font color="#000000">  Because I won&#39;t be there, </font></span><font color="#000000">I’ve included the list I’d
like to rehearse with Noel – in order of importance – and we will not get
through all of them in rehearsal.</font><span><font color="#000000">  </font></span><font color="#000000">So please,
please take some extra time to review the songs.</font><span><font color="#000000">  </font></span></span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"> </span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

free to add in or change what you thing is pertinent.</span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"> </span></font></p><div><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</font>Have an amazing rehearsal!</div><div>Barb<br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi all - Thanks so much for your hard work in rehearsal.  As we will not be rehearsing again until the 19th - which will be our March rehearsal with Noel - I wanted to give you the songs that will likely be sung for each service in Passion week - subject to change!</div><div><br></div><div>Please note: We have NOT reviewed all of the songs below!  Take some time to look through them and make sure we won&#39;t find any surprises popping out at us while we are singing them!</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div><strong>Palm Sunday:</strong></div><div><br></div><div><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font></td><td width="75" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:45pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"> </span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt">Praise
  is Rising (from perimeter)</span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font></td></tr></tbody></table><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - just a reminder that we have rehearsal with Noel tomorrow night.  We will be practicing our new songs for Palm Sunday and Good Friday - specifically the Mozart piece &#39;Ave Verum Corpus&#39; and the new &#39;Praise is Rising&#39; sheet music.</div><div><br></div><div>See you tomorrow -</div><div>Barb<br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi Simone - I&#39;m sorry I just saw your email this morning. </div><div><br></div><div>Is the hymn a tune that we would recognize?  I&#39;m asking because I find that prior to service instrumentals with new, unfamiliar melodies are great.  And for contemplative parts mid-service, an unfamiliar melody can be more of a distraction than a help in contemplating.  In those cases, familiar is much more comforting and conducive to contemplation.</div><div><br></div><div>Apostle Fendt replied to my email about song suggestions that we will need a song to prepare for Holy Communion for the departed, which I didn&#39;t include in the list, and prefer a vocal piece for that because the piece after Communion for the departed is instrumental.</div><div><br></div><div>Would your piece work for after Communion for the departed?  If it&#39;s familiar, then 2:45 min would be a bit long but still doable.  If it&#39;s not familiar, then 2:45 may seem like hours.  Kind of like when you&#39;re driving somewhere for the very first time on unfamiliar roads and it seems like you&#39;ll never get there, but on the way back, because you&#39;ve already made the trip and know what to expect, it seems way quicker - even though it&#39;s the same distance and same amount of time.</div><div><br></div><div>We could use your piece during congregational Communion, then maybe a piano piece after.</div><div><br></div><div>We could take out one of the choir songs before service (maybe &#39;Near to the heart of God&#39;) and have your piece right before service - and then use &#39;Near to the heart of God&#39; before Communion for the departed.  Maybe with the small group of us that rehearsed it with Noel (Betsy, Diana, Jon, John, you and me).  Or just drop the song and have a solo, duet, quartet piece - Like C461 - &quot;In remembrance of Me&quot;.</div><div><br></div><div>Thoughts, anyone?  None of this is set in stone.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!  Barb</div><div class="gmail_extra"><br></div><div class="gmail_quote">On Thu, Feb 4, 2016 at 9:59 PM, Simone Ehmann <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:simehmann@aol.com" target="_blank">simehmann@aol.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 0.8ex;padding-left:1ex;border-left-color:rgb(204,204,204);border-left-width:1px;border-left-style:solid"><div dir="auto"><div>Dear Barb and Jason,</div><div><br></div><div>If there is a space during this coming Sunday&#39;s service - either for Repentance, after Communion or before Communion for the Departed (if we should celebrate it) - I was thinking of a contemplative piece of organ music (app. 2:45 min) that is based on an old (16th century) hymn to the text written below. The translation into English is for the most part from me, so there wouldn&#39;t be any copyright issues displaying it, should it fit into Sunday&#39;s context.<br><br>Betsy has offered to also add something on the piano, and maybe we can get someone to sing a solo? </div><div><br></div><div>Have a good rest of the week,</div><div><br></div><div>Simone</div><div><br>Sent from my iPad</div><div><br><br></div><blockquote type="cite"><div><b>Translation </b><div><br></div><div>














<p class="MsoNormal">I call to Thee, Lord Jesus Christ,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">I plea: hear my lamenting;<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Extend Thy grace to me now,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Please let me not despair.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">The righteous path, o Lord I seek,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">I&#39;m asking Thou to show me,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">To live to Thee,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">To be of help to my neighbor,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">To truly keep Thy word.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u></u> <u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><b>Original (Johann Agricola, 1494 - 1566)</b></p><p class="MsoNormal">Ich ruf&#39; zu dir, Herr Jesu Christ,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Ich bitt&#39;: erhoer mein Klagen;<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Verleih&#39; mir Gnad zu dieser Frist,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Lass&#39; mich doch nicht verzagen.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Den rechten Weg, o Herr, ich mein&#39;,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Den wollest du mir geben,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Dir zu leben,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Mein&#39;m Naechsten nuetz zu sein,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">Dein Wort zu halten eben.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u></u> <u></u></p>

</div></div></blockquote></div></blockquote></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">

</font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. Thanks, Jon for doing this.</div><div><br></div><div>In our session on Monday, we spent time re-learning how to sing old, OLD songs that have been sung for more than half a century.  </div><div><br></div><div>As always, a good time was had by all!</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div class="gmail_quote"><div dir="ltr"><br></div><div dir="ltr"><div style="direction:ltr">

<div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br>

 ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br>

HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br>

 ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br>

I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></div>
<div dir="ltr"><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>Hi All - I hope everyone is surviving the impact of the blizzard.  <br><br>I just am confirming that unless I hear otherwise from Noel, we are still on for rehearsal tomorrow night - Monday 25 January at 7pm.<br><br></div>Below are potential songs we will be reviewing with Noel:  Have an amazing rest of your day!  Barb<br></div><div><br></div>Celebration:<br>3 - Holy, holy, holy<br></div>297 - Hosanna, Loud Hosanna<br>300 - All glory, laud and honor<br></div></div><div>338 - Wonderful grace of Jesus<br></div><div>363 - A wonderful Savior is Jesus<br></div><div>545 - Moment by moment<br></div><div>586 - He&#39;s got the whole world in His hands<br></div><div>617 - Near to the heart of God<br></div><div>620 - Under His wings<br></div><br>Hymnal:<br></div>220 - Trust and Obey<br>487 - In humble guise He&#39;s nearing<br></div><br><div><div>Choir book:<br></div>7 - Fear not O little flock<br><div>8 - A heart like Thine</div>65 - The greatest goal<br>98 - Savior, lead me lest I stray<br><div>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10pt">255 - The overcomer<br></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><br><span style="font-size:10pt"></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10pt"></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:10pt"><br></span></p><div><div><div><div>-- <br><div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<p>the texts to most of these older classical pieces are hundreds (some more than a thousand) years old and in the public domain.</p>

<p>Palm Sunday is always a difficult service to find songs for because the focus of Passion week is Good Friday and Easter.<br></p>
<p>So I&#39;ve been searching for contemporary &quot;Hosanna&quot; songs and I&#39;ve found one that I&#39;d like your opinion on.<br></p>
<p>PLEASE disregard the way the song is sung - very &quot;sweet&quot; and &quot;cute&quot; - and really unlike what Noel is teaching us.<br></p>
<p>The recordings have full orchestration and we would do them with just a piano accompaniment.<br></p>
<p>The first is a shorter version and sung very &quot;choral-y&quot;.  The second is sung in a style more in line with the lyrics (though both still sound &quot;sweet!&quot;), and is quite long, and I&#39;d likely cut some of it out.<br></p>
<p>Again, please let me know your thoughts.  Click on (or cut and paste)  each link, then click on the &quot;LISTEN&quot; button.<br></p>
<p>Version 1: (Vicky Tucker Courtney arrangement)</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527</a><br></p>
<p>Version 2: (Richard Kingsmore arrangement):</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262</a></p>
<p>And if you have any other suggestions for Palm Sunday songs - I&#39;m all ears!  I&#39;m looking at a few different versions of Holy! Holy! Holy!<br></p>
<p>For Good Friday it is very likely we will do Mozart&#39;s &quot;Ave Verum Copus&quot; (we&#39;ve sung it as &quot;Lead Us Heavenly Father&quot;).  What are your thoughts about singing it in Latin and displaying an English version of the words (which are NOT &quot;Lead us Heavenly Father!&quot;) on the monitor?  It is a classical piece written in Latin - but is singing it in Latin too Catholic for us at this time?<br></p>
<p>Thanks,</p>
<p>Barb<br></p>

<p>Hi all - I&#39;m looking for your input, please.<br></p>
<p>Palm Sunday is always a difficult service to find songs for because the focus of Passion week is Good Friday and Easter.<br></p>
<p>So I&#39;ve been searching for contemporary &quot;Hosanna&quot; songs and I&#39;ve found one that I&#39;d like your opinion on.<br></p>
<p>PLEASE disregard the way the song is sung - very &quot;sweet&quot; and &quot;cute&quot; - and really unlike what Noel is teaching us.<br></p>
<p>The recordings have full orchestration and we would do them with just a piano accompaniment.<br></p>
<p>The first is a shorter version and sung very &quot;choral-y&quot;.  The second is sung in a style more in line with the lyrics (though both still sound &quot;sweet!&quot;), and is quite long, and I&#39;d likely cut some of it out.<br></p>
<p>Again, please let me know your thoughts.  Click on (or cut and paste)  each link, then click on the &quot;LISTEN&quot; button.<br></p>
<p>Version 1: (Vicky Tucker Courtney arrangement)</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527</a><br></p>
<p>Version 2: (Richard Kingsmore arrangement):</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262</a></p>
<p>And if you have any other suggestions for Palm Sunday songs - I&#39;m all ears!  I&#39;m looking at a few different versions of Holy! Holy! Holy!<br></p>
<p>For Good Friday it is very likely we will do Mozart&#39;s &quot;Ave Verum Copus&quot; (we&#39;ve sung it as &quot;Lead Us Heavenly Father&quot;).  What are your thoughts about singing it in Latin and displaying an English version of the words (which are NOT &quot;Lead us Heavenly Father!&quot;) on the monitor?  It is a classical piece written in Latin - but is singing it in Latin too Catholic for us at this time?<br></p>
<p>Thanks,</p>
<p>Barb<br></p>
<p>-- </p>
<p>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br>
 ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria</p>
<p>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.</p>
<p>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br>
 ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br></p>

</font></div><div><br></div><div><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div><div><div>Hi All - <br><br>Here are the songs for Sunday 6 December.  We will have a brief rehearsal after service to review a few of the songs that we will practice with Noel next Monday 14 December.<br><br></div><div>And a reminder - if anyone would like to do a solo or small group/duet or instrumental during this Advent and Christmas season, please let me know what you&#39;re thinking about doing and for what service.<br><br></div><div>Thanks!<br></div><div>Barb<br></div><div><br>

<br></div>Songs for review tomorrow (where needed) to rehearsal with Noel next Monday:<br></div>C 86 - Jesus name above all names (new - this is a lead in to #87 Fairest Lord Jesus)<br></div><div>C292 - Thou didst leave Thy throne (new)<br></div>C287 - Communion Hymn<br><div><div><div>C279 - Infant holy, Infant lowly<br></div><div>C254 - Isn&#39;t He<br></div><div>C240 - Of the Father&#39;s love begotten<br></div><div>C280 - One small child<br></div><div>C263 - What can I give Him<br></div><div>C267 - I head the bells<br></div><div>C256 - Love has come (same tune as Bring a Torch Jeanette Isabella)<br></div><div>H540 - Gentle Mary laid her child (same tune as Good King Wenceslas)<br clear="all"></div><div><div>   1 - All glory be to God on high<br><br><br></div><div>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></div></div></div></div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - </div><div><br></div><div>Just wanted to confirm with everyone the rehearsal plan for the rest of the year.</div><div><br></div><div><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)"><strong>Sunday 6 December</strong>:</font>  This coming Sunday we will have a very abbreviated version of our regularly scheduled rehearsal (1st and 3rd Sundays of the month) immediately following service.  This is to review a few Christmas songs so we can rehearse them with Noel the following Monday.</div><div><br></div><div><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)"><strong>Monday 14 December</strong>:</font>  Noel will be with us to work on Christmas songs.</div><div><br></div><div><strong><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)">Sunday 3 or 10 January:</font></strong>  Our next rehearsal after that will be either the 3rd or 10th of January - which, rather than a singing rehearsal, will be a discussion around moving forward and getting your input for our plans for the New Year. Please let me know which one of those Sundays will work better for you.</div><div> <br clear="all">Thank you all for all you do!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr">When the Ev asked about the availability on that date I reminded him that we had rehearsal that day.  He didn&#39;t want to change the date of the meeting and asked that we have a &quot;short&quot; rehearsal.  I&#39;d like to review a couple of songs so we have the notes down when we meet with Noel on December 14th.  So we will still rehearsl.</div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Mon, Nov 30, 2015 at 11:43 AM, Jonathan White <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com" target="_blank">jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div>Hey Barb,</div><div><br></div><div>I just noticed that we have practice scheduled during this time. </blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - </div><div><br></div><div>I&#39;m looking forward to having and sharing a wonderful Thanksgiving experience with everyone tomorrow.  </div><div><br></div><div>Next weekend - Sunday 29 November - is the first Sunday of Advent as well as our Worship service.  We will be singing new songs for the worship service, which have only been rehearsed once, with Noel.  </div><div><br></div><div>To make sure all are familiar with the new worship songs,<font color="#000000"><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)"> </font><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)"><strong>we will have rehearsal tomorrow - 22 November - after service.</strong> <font color="#ff0000"></font></font></font><font color="#ff0000"> </font>We will then go back to our regular schedule, with Sunday December 6th being the next rehearsal after tomorrow.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks, so much.  See you all tomorrow!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Tue, Nov 17, 2015 at 9:10 AM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 0.8ex;padding-left:1ex;border-left-color:rgb(204,204,204);border-left-width:1px;border-left-style:solid"><div dir="ltr"><div>Good morning choir,</div><div><br></div><div>Below are the songs for our Thanksgiving Service this coming Sunday.  </div><div><br></div><div>Have a great week!<br></div><div><br></div><div>Jason</div><div><br></div><div><table style="border:currentColor;border-collapse:collapse" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

</blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<div dir="ltr"><div><div>Hi Jason - Great song list!  One song I don&#39;t think we know is H100.  I know it because it was in the old choir book and we sang it in Buffalo (and I think it used to be in the key of E major - with 4 sharps - if I recall correctly).  And in the 15 years I&#39;ve been in White Plains I don&#39;t recall singing it - but I certainly haven&#39;t been in every service here.<br><br></div>Thoughts from our organists and directors?  Do you know this one, or are you familiar with it?<br><br></div>Thanks, Barb<br></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Sat, Nov 14, 2015 at 9:30 AM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div>Dear Choir,</div><div><br></div><div>Below you will find the songs for tomorrow&#39;s service.  This coming Monday, Noel will be with us from 7 - 9 PM to help prepare for the start of advent on November 29th.  That means we will not have rehearsal after service tomorrow.  </div><div><br></div><div>Have a great day!</div><br><div><table style="font-size:12.8px;border:currentcolor;border-collapse:collapse" border="1" cellpadding="0" <div dir="ltr"><div>Hey Jason - There&#39;s actually 4 different songs in the Celebration hymnal using that same Haydn melody.  We&#39;ve never used them because they are the same as (and excuse my spelling here) &quot;Duetchland, Duetchland Uber Alles&quot; - used by the Germans during Hitler&#39;s time.  When we first got the Celebration hymnal and I was going to practice one of them maybe 7 or so years ago, Simone was pretty upset. <br><br></div><div>Things and attitudes may have changed since then.  So would you please reach out to Simone and get her take on it?  See if she&#39;s OK with it?  If not, then I would HIGHLY advise against using it.<br><br></div><div>Thanks!  Barb<br></div></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Sat, Nov 14, 2015 at 9:16 AM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr">Hi Barb,<div>No problem, I&#39;ll send the note out.  Do you think we can go over C796 quickly on Monday?  It&#39;s a &quot;familiar&quot; tune but I don&#39;t believe anyone has sung it before.</div><div>Thanks,</div><div>Jason</div></div><div class="HOEnZb"><div class="h5"><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Fri, Nov 13, 2015 at 6:30 PM, Barb Schenk <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com" target="_blank">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div>Hi Jason - When you send out the songs for Sunday, could you please mention that we will NOT have rehearsal after service, but will have rehearsal on Monday, 18 November, at 7pm with Noel.  We&#39;d like to work on the songs for the Advent program unless there is something specific that you need to work on for Thanksgiving Sunday.</div><div><br></div><div>I&#39;m thinking we should ask for a special rehearsal if we need it to accommodate all the things coming up.  Let me know what you think.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><span><font color="#888888"><div>Barb<br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name.   </font><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:42pt;background-color:transparent" valign="top" width="70"><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt" class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Calibri"><span style="font-size:11pt">H<span>  </span>425</span></font></p><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">
  </font></td><td><font face="Times New Roman">

  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt" class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Calibri"><span style="font-size:11pt">v5</span></font></p><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">
  </font></td><td><font face="Times New Roman">
  </font><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:157.5pt;background-color:transparent" valign="top" width="263"><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt" class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000000" size="2" face="Calibri"><span style="font-size:11pt">The
  Bridegroom comes</span></font></p><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">

</font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

</div></blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

 </font></div><div><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi Jon - so sorry this took so long.  Here&#39;s the songs I&#39;ve put together for tomorrow.  Let me know if there&#39;s anything that you&#39;re not OK with and I&#39;ll find something else. If you&#39;re OK then I&#39;ll send them off to the list - or you can send them.  I have no preference.</div><div> </div><div>Thanks!</div><div>Barb</div><div> </div><div> </div><div><font color="#000000" size="3" face="Times New Roman">

</font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

</font>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br></div>

  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:41.25pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="55"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal" align="center"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">H396</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:24.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="33"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal" align="center"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3"> </font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:195.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="261"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;line-height:normal"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">The love of God</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">

  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:195.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="261"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;line-height:normal"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">The Bridegroom comes</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td></tr></tbody></table><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">

</font></div></div><div dir="ltr"><div><br></div><div><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></blockquote></div>
</div></div></blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - </div><div><br></div><div>Hope you are having a wonderful week.  Here are the song suggestions for Sunday.  There is no rehearsal this week - and I wouldn&#39;t be disappointed if, on the way to church, we each did some breathing, and &quot;VIN&quot;s and &quot;VONT&quot;s!</div><div>No worries what people will think - there&#39;s no one on the road on Sunday morning to see you acting crazing in your car! 😂</div><div><br></div><div>See you Sunday morning.  We will start singing at 10:15.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>Barb</div><div><br></div><div><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. <div dir="ltr">Hi Jon - I realize it&#39;s just the beginning of October - but could you please keep an eye out for the publishing/posting of the November DSG?  I&#39;d like to get the songs ready for service for the departed - hopefully in time to practice them at our next rehearsal on 18 October.  Thanks!  Barb<br clear="all"><div><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<br><br></div>Last week&#39;s note regarding rehearsals:<br>Dear Choir,<div><br></div><div>Thank you all for your efforts last week,
 singing and rehearsing.  For those that were not able to stay for the 
rehearsal, it was very constructive and here are some of the highlights:</div><div><ul><li><b>Future rehearsals will be held after service for approx. 30 minutes on the 1st and 3rd Sunday of the month.</b> 
 That means no rehearsal this Sunday and no more early mornings!  Sleep 
in, enjoy your coffee (w/o milk per Barb&#39;s instruction), and eat some 
breakfast!</li><li><b>Attending rehearsal is not mandatory in order to sing in the choir or to &quot;sing that day&quot;!</b> 
 I know some of us are still under this impression.  Obviously, as the 
&quot;directors&quot;,  we encourage you to attend because this is when we get to 
learn and practice the cool new songs with the awesome words...but it&#39;s 
no longer mandatory (and hasn&#39;t been for sometime).  If you happen to 
get caught in the choir, and you don&#39;t know a song, just fake it till 
you make it!<br></li><li><b>Please extend the invitation to all of those that would like to sing.  </b>Whether
 you&#39;d like to sing every service, once in a while, or when you&#39;re in 
the mood; just show up.  Black and White is not required (but Mary and 
Jon are)!  If you only have time for a special song once in a while, 
share this with one of the directors (Barb, D. White, or myself) and we 
will be more than happy to schedule you in!</li><li><b>If you REALLY want to learn how to sing, join us for one of the rehearsals with a <span style="font-weight:normal"> </span><b>real vocal coach!</b> </b>We&#39;ve
 been enjoying an awesome opportunity to learn from a real vocal coach 
that has been showing up in our week night rehearsals for the past 
couple of months.  For those that want to learn how to sing, or for 
those that think they know how to sing (like me), show up to one or all 
of the remaining rehearsals from 7-9 PM on the following Mondays: <span style="font-size:12.8px">Sept/28, <span><span>Oct/26</span></span>, <span><span>Nov/16</span></span>, and <span><span>Dec/14</span></span>. 
 Don&#39;t worry about showing up late or having to leave early.  Bring a 
friend if you&#39;d like, it&#39;s starting to get cold and dark at night!</span></li></ul><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">More formal announcements will be made but there&#39;s a sneak peek.  <br></span></div></div><br><div>Thanks!<span class="HOEnZb"><font color="#888888"><br></font></span></div><span class="HOEnZb"><font color="#888888"><div>Barb<br></div><div><br clear="all"><div><div><div><div><div><br>-- <br><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div></font></span></div>
</blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<br><br></div>Last week&#39;s note regarding rehearsals:<br>Dear Choir,<div><br></div><div>Thank you all for your efforts last week,
 singing and rehearsing.  For those that were not able to stay for the 
rehearsal, it was very constructive and here are some of the highlights:</div><div><ul><li><b>Future rehearsals will be held after service for approx. 30 minutes on the 1st and 3rd Sunday of the month.</b> 
 That means no rehearsal this Sunday and no more early mornings!  Sleep 
in, enjoy your coffee (w/o milk per Barb&#39;s instruction), and eat some 
breakfast!</li><li><b>Attending rehearsal is not mandatory in order to sing in the choir or to &quot;sing that day&quot;!</b> 
 I know some of us are still under this impression.  Obviously, as the 
&quot;directors&quot;,  we encourage you to attend because this is when we get to 
learn and practice the cool new songs with the awesome words...but it&#39;s 
no longer mandatory (and hasn&#39;t been for sometime).  If you happen to 
get caught in the choir, and you don&#39;t know a song, just fake it till 
you make it!<br></li><li><b>Please extend the invitation to all of those that would like to sing.  </b>Whether
 you&#39;d like to sing every service, once in a while, or when you&#39;re in 
the mood; just show up.  Black and White is not required (but Mary and 
Jon are)!  If you only have time for a special song once in a while, 
share this with one of the directors (Barb, D. White, or myself) and we 
will be more than happy to schedule you in!</li><li><b>If you REALLY want to learn how to sing, join us for one of the rehearsals with a <span style="font-weight:normal"> </span><b>real vocal coach!</b> </b>We&#39;ve
 been enjoying an awesome opportunity to learn from a real vocal coach 
that has been showing up in our week night rehearsals for the past 
couple of months.  For those that want to learn how to sing, or for 
those that think they know how to sing (like me), show up to one or all 
of the remaining rehearsals from 7-9 PM on the following Mondays: <span style="font-size:12.8px">Sept/28, <span tabindex="0" class=""><span class="">Oct/26</span></span>, <span tabindex="0" class=""><span class="">Nov/16</span></span>, and <span tabindex="0" class=""><span class="">Dec/14</span></span>. 
 Don&#39;t worry about showing up late or having to leave early.  Bring a 
friend if you&#39;d like, it&#39;s starting to get cold and dark at night!</span></li></ul><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">More formal announcements will be made but there&#39;s a sneak peek.  <br></span></div></div><br><div>Thanks!<br></div><div>Barb<br></div><div><br clear="all"><div><div><div><div><div><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<p>hi jason -</p>
<p>i just played thru the songs.  i just now asked betsy to play the lords prayer and i&#39;m waiting to hear back from her.  it&#39;s unison so we should be fine with her playing. </p>
<p>we don&#39;t know cel 734 - though it&#39;s a nice one and we should add it to our list for a sunday rehearsal</p>
<p>fyi 142 thy will be done is on the list twice - once pre svc and once text/mid svc</p>
<p>i probably won&#39;t play for 142 and c690 - they are oldies that will likely sound better a capella (not sure how to spell that!) - but i&#39;ll be ready to jump in if needed<br>

<p>Hi All - Here are the song suggestions for tomorrow, depending on how many ppl we have to sing on this holiday weekend. See you then!  Barb</p>
<p>pre1:  57 This glorious Sunday morning<br>
pre2:  h44 Let all things now living<br>
pre3:  h376 I praise God&#39;s love in adoration<br>
pre4:  h2 All creatures of our God and King<br>
open:  h66 To God be the glory<br>
text:  h54 O that I had a thousand voices<br>
mid1:  h149 v1&amp;2 Seek ye first the kingdom of God<br>
mid2:  h33 All people that on earth do dwell<br>
repentance:  h110 Thee will I love<br>
communion:  h538 Fairest Lord Jesus<br>
close: h21 O God beyond all praising</p>
<p>-- </p>
<p>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br>
 ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria</p>
<p>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.</p>

 ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br></p>

My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - Here are the song suggestions for Sunday 12 Juiy.  My sincere apologies as I thought I had made arrangements to have someone else direct in my place for today.  I am in Rochester celebrating my sister&#39;s birthday.  Thank you, Jason, for inquiring about the song list and prompting me to look at the schedule and get a list of songs out to everyone.<br clear="all"></div><div>We are on summer hiatus and will not have rehearsals again until after Labor Day in September.  In September we will start rhearsing for our Worship Evening in November as well as have monthly rehearsals with Noel.</div><div> </div><div>Have a wonderful, amazing morning with Bishop Schmidt!</div><div>Barb</div><div>xxoo</div><div> </div><div> </div><div>Pre1:  50:  The Lord is my Light</div><div>Pre2:  C583:  You are my All in All</div><div>Pre3:  H189:  I know whom I have believed</div><div>Pre4:  H200 or 168 in choir book:  Make no plans without the Lord</div><div> </div><div>Open:  H211:  Strong is my Lord Jesus&#39; hand</div><div>Text:    H149:  Seek ye first the kingdom of God</div><div>Mid1:   54:    Give me thy heart</div><div>Mid2:   H140:  Make me a servant</div><div>Mid3:   H92:  In Christ alone<br></div><div>Repentance:  H236:  Before my heart&#39;s King bowing</div><div>Communion:  H75:   Blessed Assurance</div><div> </div><div>Close:  H172 - A mighty fortress is our God</div><div> </div><div>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
