<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi all - Here are the songs for Sunday&#39;s service.</div><div> </div><div><strong><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)">We will be standing in different configurations to sing the songs before service, as well as for the songs during service.  Rehearsal will start promptly at 9:30.  </font></strong><strong><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)">Please be at church by <font color="#ff0000">9:25 </font>so that we can get the logistics figured out and get comfortable with the new configurations.</font></strong></div><div> </div><div><strong><font style="background-color:rgb(255,255,0)">Please also take some time to re-listen to the recordings of the rehearsals we had with Noel.  That will go a very long way in preparing us to sing our very best for our loved ones in eternity.</font></strong></div><div> </div><div>See you at 9:25 Sunday morning - ready to go!  This is our last rehearsal for the summer.  Our next rehearsal will be after Labor Day on 13 September.</div><div>Barb</div><div> </div><div><strong>Songs:</strong> </div><div><strong>Pre1:</strong>  H2 - v1,4 - All creatures of our God and King</div><div><strong>Pre2:</strong>  H329 - Jesus what a Friend for sinners</div><div><strong>Pre3:</strong>  H301 - See who&#39;s standing at your door</div><div><strong>Pre4:</strong>  Sheet music - Thy word is a lamp</div><div> </div><div><strong>Open:</strong>  H401 - Where charity and love prevail</div><div><strong>Text:    </strong> 128 - How can I forget?</div><div><strong>Mid1:</strong>   H158 v3 - The time of grace redeem today</div><div><strong>Mid2:</strong>     288 v2 - Lord, at Thy throne of grace</div><div><strong>Mid3: </strong>  H84 - I am Thine, O Lord</div><div><br clear="all"><strong>Repentance:</strong>  H335 v3 - The great Physician</div><div><strong>Communion:</strong>  HH345 - Beautiful, glorious moment</div><div><strong></strong> </div><div><strong>Departed:</strong>  H311 - Amazing grace</div><div><strong></strong> </div><div><strong>Close:</strong>  C604 - I then shall live</div><div><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi Simone - Here are the songs for Sunday 21 June, 2015.  If there are any that may be an issue, please let me know and I will swap them out.  <br><br>We will also be looking at two songs for Service for the Departed which we have worked on with Noel:  &quot;How can I forget&quot;, and &quot;Thy word is a lamp&quot;<br></div><br>After July Service for the Departed, we will take a break from rehearsals for the summer and start up again after Labor day<br><div><br>Thanks!  Barb<br><br>

  house is our delight

  flock

  Shepherd lead us

  v4
  Welcome to the fount
  of mercy

  v4

  pleasant

  my Shepherd

  and fair

  v3
  I will praise Thee

<div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - I&#39;m looking for suggestions for a few songs we can use for rehearsl with Noel.&nbsp; Here&#39;s what we need:</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>1.&nbsp; One or two that we know very well and are very comfortable and familar with.&nbsp; We&#39;ll need to sing for about 10 minutes - so I&#39;m looking for at least 2 song suggestions.&nbsp; (And of course the first one that jumped into my head was &quot;50B&quot;! lol! )</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>2.&nbsp; A song that we do NOT know that we can start working on.&nbsp; It can be a big dramatic song from the &quot;printable online section&quot; of <a href="http://musiccompanion.org">musiccompanion.org</a> or even some sheet music you love.&nbsp; What I&#39;m looking for is something that&nbsp;we don&#39;t know, will love to learn and sing but that will take&nbsp;time and a bit of effort&nbsp;to learn.</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>I have some ideas and would like to hear yours as well.&nbsp;I&#39;m going to go home and take a look at my &quot;wish-list&quot; of songs.&nbsp; Please let me know what songs you just love and want to learn.</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>Jon - we will definitely need to video the session.&nbsp; I&#39;m really getting excited!&nbsp; This will be great and FUN!</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>Thanks!</div><div>Barb<br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;&nbsp; <br>&nbsp;~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:&nbsp; The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.&nbsp; &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.&nbsp; In those days when you pray, I will listen.&nbsp; If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br>&nbsp;~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 &ndash; New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;&nbsp; <br>&nbsp;~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:&nbsp; The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.&nbsp; &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.&nbsp; In those days when you pray, I will listen.&nbsp; If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br>&nbsp;~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 &ndash; New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

</font>Have an amazing rehearsal!</div><span class="HOEnZb"><font color="#888888"><div>Barb<br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

  </td>
  <td width="302" valign="top" style="width:226.4pt;border-style:none solid solid none;border-bottom-color:windowtext;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-right-color:windowtext;border-right-width:1pt;padding:0in 5.4pt;height:14pt">
  <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0.0001pt">To God be the glory</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="height:14pt">
  <td width="146" valign="top" style="width:109.7pt;border-style:none solid solid;border-right-color:windowtext;border-bottom-color:windowtext;border-left-color:windowtext;border-right-width:1pt;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-left-width:1pt;padding:0in 5.4pt;height:14pt">
  <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0.0001pt">Close</p>
  </td>
  <td width="71" valign="top" style="width:53.2pt;border-style:none solid solid none;border-bottom-color:windowtext;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-right-color:windowtext;border-right-width:1pt;padding:0in 5.4pt;height:14pt">
  <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0.0001pt">C809</p>

  <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0.0001pt">1,4</p>

  <td width="302" valign="top" style="width:226.4pt;border-style:none solid solid none;border-bottom-color:windowtext;border-bottom-width:1pt;border-right-color:windowtext;border-right-width:1pt;padding:0in 5.4pt;height:14pt">
  <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0.0001pt">God of our Fathers</p>

Thanks for the heads up.&nbsp;<br><br>Sent from my iPhone</div><div><br>On Nov 14, 2015, at 9:54 AM, Barb Schenk &lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt; wrote:<br><br></div><blockquote type="cite"><div><div dir="ltr"><div>Hey Jason - There's actually 4 different songs in the Celebration hymnal using that same Haydn melody.&nbsp; We've never used them because they are the same as (and excuse my spelling here) "Duetchland, Duetchland Uber Alles" - used by the Germans during Hitler's time.&nbsp; When we first got the Celebration hymnal and I was going to practice one of them maybe 7 or so years ago, Simone was pretty upset. <br><br></div><div>Things and attitudes may have changed since then.&nbsp; So would you please reach out to Simone and get her take on it?&nbsp; See if she's OK with it?&nbsp; If not, then I would HIGHLY advise against using it.<br><br></div><div>Thanks!&nbsp; Barb<br></div></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Sat, Nov 14, 2015 at 9:16 AM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr">Hi Barb,<div>No problem, I'll send the note out.&nbsp; </div></div></blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
</div></div></blockquote></div><br></div>
</div></div></blockquote></div><br></div>
<div dir="ltr">Dear Choir,<div><br></div><div>Thank you all for your efforts last week, singing and rehearsing.  For those that were not able to stay for the rehearsal, it was very constructive and here are some of the highlights:</div><div><ul><li><b>Future rehearsals will be held after service for approx. 30 minutes on the 1st and 3rd Sunday of the month.</b>  That means no rehearsal this Sunday and no more early mornings!  Sleep in, enjoy your coffee (w/o milk per Barb&#39;s instruction), and eat some breakfast!</li><li><b>Attending rehearsal is not mandatory in order to sing in the choir or to &quot;sing that day&quot;!</b>  I know some of us are still under this impression.  Obviously, as the &quot;directors&quot;,  we encourage you to attend because this is when we get to learn and practice the cool new songs with the awesome words...but it&#39;s no longer mandatory (and hasn&#39;t been for sometime).  If you happen to get caught in the choir, and you don&#39;t know a song, just fake it till you make it!<br></li><li><b>Please extend the invitation to all of those that would like to sing.  </b>Whether you&#39;d like to sing every service, once in a while, or when you&#39;re in the mood; just show up.  Black and White is not required (but Mary and Jon are)!  If you only have time for a special song once in a while, share this with one of the directors (Barb, D. White, or myself) and we will be more than happy to schedule you in!</li><li><b>If you REALLY want to learn how to sing, join us for one of the rehearsals with a <span style="font-weight:normal"> </span><b>real vocal coach!</b> </b>We&#39;ve been enjoying an awesome opportunity to learn from a real vocal coach that has been showing up in our week night rehearsals for the past couple of months.  For those that want to learn how to sing, or for those that think they know how to sing (like me), show up to one or all of the remaining rehearsals from 7-9 PM on the following Mondays: <span style="font-size:12.8px">Sept/28, Oct/26, Nov/16, and Dec/14.  Don&#39;t worry about showing up late or having to leave early.  Bring a friend if you&#39;d like, it&#39;s starting to get cold and dark at night!</span></li></ul><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">More formal announcements will be made but there&#39;s a sneak peek.  </span></div></div><div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px"><br></span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">Now, on to Sunday and the song suggestions.</span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px"><br></span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">Officiant Scheduled: Ev. Murray</span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">Organist: Sis. Schenk</span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">Director: Br. Baisch</span></div><div><span style="font-size:12.8px">Bible verse: </span><i style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:10pt;color:rgb(0,112,192)">If you ask anything in My name, I will do it. John 14: 14</span></i></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify"><i><span style="font-size:10pt;color:rgb(0,112,192)"></span></i></p><div><span <div dir="ltr">Hi Barb, I thought about that too and thought that his speech might be more widely accepted if people have a chance to read and digest the information on their own prior to the announcement.  Plus I&#39;m sort of sneaking it in along with the songs for Sunday so that it doesn&#39;t come as an out of nowhere BIG, INTIMIDATING announcement.  <div><br></div><div>Regarding songs for Thanksgiving and Christmas, I know that I am scheduled to direct, but that doesn&#39;t mean I have to pick all the songs and/or direct them all.  So if you guys have some suggestions, please do share.  Thanks for the additional email addresses as well.  I&#39;ll be sure to add them.  <div><br></div><div>Jon, I didn&#39;t see your original remarks to Barb about email invites for rehearsals but I think its an excellent idea.  I just put reminders on my Calendar today (finally) with all the rehearsals for Noel and also the days I&#39;m directing.  I think a reminder for the Choir to add to their Calendar is an excellent reminder.  Anything put down on &quot;paper&quot; instantly has a greater chance of being done.  I think the calendar invites/reminders alone might help to boost attendance and participation.  </div><div><br></div><div>And thanks Barb for allowing us the freedom to do, what we do.</div><div><br></div><div>J</div></div></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Fri, Sep 25, 2015 at 10:49 PM, Barb Schenk <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com" target="_blank">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr"><div><div><div>Jason - great message - very upbeat and enthusiastic.  I was kind of waiting until Pr. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</font></span></div>
</blockquote></div><br></div>
</blockquote></div>
</div></div></blockquote></div><br></div>

I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

I am organizing all Barb's picks as well so that you can get the full picture.</div><div><br></div><div>I'm cc'ing Barb just in-case there is anything she wants to add.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Mon, Jan 12, 2015 at 5:02 PM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr">Hi Jon,<div><br></div><div>Please let me know which Sunday I am picking for so that I know what to practice this coming Sunday, unless you have some songs already chosen that you would like me to go over that morning.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks,</div><div>Jason</div></div>

</body></html><div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tonight.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-d66b31f9-82ce-9073-8d94-0f9afaa83530"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Thursday, May 5th 2016</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Before Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H381 - “Jesus, Lord, we Look to Thee”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Opening Hymn (Suggestion):</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H434 - “When He Cometh”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Text:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H459; v. 2 - “On Your Ascension, Lord, alone”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">During Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H410; v. 2 - “Gird on your Armour”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Hymn of Repentance:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H318; v. 6 -     <tbody>

            <tr>
                <td valign="top" style="padding:20px;padding-bottom:20px">

                    <table align="left" width="273" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse">

I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

</body></html><div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tonight&#39;s word service.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-c5b704d2-eb2f-143c-5eb7-1a16e081bc4d"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Wednesday, April 6th 2016</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Before Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H373; v. 1,4 - “I Praise God’s Love in Adoration” [Congregation]</span></p></li><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">130; v. 3 - “I then shall live”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">During Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">C244; v. 2 - “Come thou long expected Jesus”</span></p></li><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H243; v. 4 - “Have Thine own way Lord”</span></p></li><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H99; v. 1 - “More Holiness give me”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Hymn of Repentance:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H236; v. 1 - “Before my Heart’s King Bowing”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Communion Hymn:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H70 - “We Praise Thee Lord”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Communion:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">TBD [Instrumental]</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H302; v. 3 - “Shine, Jesus, Shine”</span></p></li></ul></span></div></div>

  </font></td><td width="46" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:34.4pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt">H302</span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font></td><td width="58" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:43.5pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font><p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt">v3</span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font></td><td width="238" valign="top" style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:178.7pt;background-color:transparent"><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt"><font color="#000000" face="Calibri" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt">Shine,
  Jesus, shine</span></font></p><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">
  </font></td></tr></tbody></table><font color="#000000" face="Times New Roman" size="3">

</font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div></div><div dir="ltr"><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

2016</div><div><br/></div><div dir="ltr"><div>Hi All - <br><br>I&#39;m so sorry that the flu has taken it&#39;s toll in White Plains.  I hope everyone is feeling better soon!<br><br></div>With all the sickness, the Good Friday song list ended up with last-minute-revamping.  We did more congregational singing and did NOT sing Mozart&#39;s Ave Verum Corpus.<br><br>If it works out, and everyone is healthy and feels up to it, we will sing the Mozart tomorrow for Easter for repentance.  Please note, this is NOT a call for anyone to overextend themselves or hurt their voice or to try anything super-heroic!  If it works out - that&#39;s a wonderful thing.  If it does not work out, then we will sing it in the next couple of weeks - the 3rd or 10th of April.  <br><br>Everyone - choir and organists alike - worked very, very hard on the Passion Week songs.  And we sound very, very good.  It can be disappointing when we&#39;ve worked so hard on something and circumstances and plans change.  I want to assure everyone that we WILL sing the Mozart, either tomorrow or in the next few weeks when it works out for everyone.  None of our rehearsing is in vain, as we carry all our learning through to every song that we sing.<br><div class="gmail_extra"><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">And one more reminder - that EVERYONE is invited to sing in the choir - whether it&#39;s once a month or once a year or every service!<br><br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Thanks, so much, for all you do!  Stay healthy!  💒<br></div><div class="gmail_extra">Barb<br></div><div color="#000000" size="2"><span style="font-size:11pt"> </span></font></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div><span class="HOEnZb"><font color="#888888"><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. </blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. </body></html><div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tonight&#39;s service.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-300bf2c1-8108-5f98-d1f8-0797082ecf48"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Wednesday, March 16th 2016</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Opening Hymn (Suggestion):</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H5 - “Be Still, for the presence of the Lord”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Text:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H473; v. 2 - “O Holy Spirit, enter in”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Hymn of Repentance:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H252; v. 1 - “Nearer, My God, to Thee”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Communion Hymn:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H329 - “Jesus, What a Friend for Sinners”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H238; v. 3 - “Dear Lord, I give Completely”</span></p></li></ul></span></div></div>
<div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tonight&#39;s service.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-d52fd74c-ef6e-1716-cace-cf0efe735542"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Wednesday, February 17th 2016</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Before Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent"> H98; v. 2,3 - “May the Mind of Christ, my Saviour”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Opening Hymn (Suggestion):</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H329 - “Jesus, What a Friend for Sinners”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Text:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H174; 1 - “Be Still, My Soul”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Hymn of Repentance:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H308; v. 2 - “Whosoever Heareth”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Communion Hymn:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H376 - “I Praise God’s Love in Adoration”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H210; v. 3 - “Star, to which I’m Looking”</span></p></li></ul></span></div></div>
<div dir="ltr">The original music is certainly out of copyright, and the Latin text is as well. The translation into English may or may not be depending on when it was done. You already saw an example of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus#Text">Wikipedia translation</a> which is out of copyright, but the are some like <a href="http://www.sfbach.org/text-ave-verum-corpus-k-618">this one</a> which are still in copyright. To display the words on the screen, we just need to make sure that the translation into English which we choose to display is in the public domain. From what I can tell, we should have a fair amount to choose from.<div><br></div><div>By the way, what I&#39;m referencing is from the Visual Aid Guidelines (Page 11 of the Spring 2015 Vision):</div><div><strong style="color:rgb(85,85,85);font-family:&#39;Open Sans&#39;;font-size:14px;line-height:18px">What Should Not Be Displayed:</strong><span style="color:rgb(85,85,85);font-family:&#39;Open Sans&#39;;font-size:14px;line-height:20px"><br></span></div><div><span style="color:rgb(85,85,85);font-family:&#39;Open Sans&#39;;font-size:14px;line-height:20px">Copyrighted lyrics (without permission to display them)</span></div><div><ul style="padding:0px 0px 0px 30px;margin:0px;color:rgb(85,85,85);font-family:&#39;Open Sans&#39;;font-size:14px;line-height:20px"><li>The lyrics to many songs, outside of hymns, are going to be copyrighted. In these cases, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder before the lyrics can be displayed. Note: just because a choir purchases sheet music for their choir members, this does not necessarily mean that the lyrics can be posted. Only if the lyrics are public domain can they be posted without permission.</li></ul></div></div><br><div class="gmail_quote"><div dir="ltr">On Wed, Jan 20, 2016 at 11:49 AM Barb Schenk &lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt; wrote:<br></div><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><p>the texts to most of these older classical pieces are hundreds (some more than a thousand) years old and in the public domain.</p>

Regarding Ave Verum Copus, I found the words on <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus" target="_blank">Wikipedia</a> here:</div><div><br></div><div><table style="color:rgb(37,37,37);line-height:22.4px;font-family:sans-serif;font-size:14px"><tbody><tr><th>Latin</th><th>English </th></tr><tr><td><div><p style="margin:0.5em 0px;line-height:inherit"><span lang="la">Ave verum corpus, natum<br>de Maria Virgine,<sup style="line-height:1;font-size:11.2px"><a style="background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration:none;white-space:nowrap" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus#cite_note-2" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup><br>vere passum, immolatum<br>in cruce pro homine<br>cuius latus perforatum<br>fluxit aqua et sanguine:<sup style="line-height:1;font-size:11.2px"><a style="background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration:none;white-space:nowrap" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus#cite_note-3" target="_blank">[3]</a></sup><br>esto nobis praegustatum<br>in mortis examine.<sup style="line-height:1;font-size:11.2px"><a style="background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration:none;white-space:nowrap" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus#cite_note-4" target="_blank">[4]</a></sup><br><br>O Iesu dulcis, O Iesu <a title="wikt:pius" style="background:none;color:rgb(102,51,102);text-decoration:none" href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/pius" target="_blank">pie</a>,<br>O Iesu, fili Mariae.<br>Miserere mei. Amen.<sup style="line-height:1;font-size:11.2px"><a style="background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration:none;white-space:nowrap" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ave_verum_corpus#cite_note-5" target="_blank">[5]</a></sup></span></p></div></td><td style="padding-left:2em"><div><p style="margin:0.5em 0px;line-height:inherit">Hail, true Body, born<br>of the Virgin Mary,<br>who having truly suffered, was sacrificed<br>on the cross for mankind,<br>whose pierced side<br>flowed with water and blood:<br>May it be for us a foretaste [of the Heavenly banquet]<br>in the trial of death.<br><br>O sweet Jesus, O holy Jesus,<br>O Jesus, son of Mary,<br>have mercy on me. Amen.</p></div></td></tr></tbody></table><br></div><div>Of course the song is beautiful, and the words seem fitting for Good Friday.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div></div><div><div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Sun, Jan 17, 2016 at 4:26 PM, Barb Schenk <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com" target="_blank">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 0.8ex;padding-left:1ex;border-left-color:rgb(204,204,204);border-left-width:1px;border-left-style:solid"><p>Hi all - I&#39;m looking for your input, please.<br></p>
<p>Palm Sunday is always a difficult service to find songs for because the focus of Passion week is Good Friday and Easter.<br></p>
<p>So I&#39;ve been searching for contemporary &quot;Hosanna&quot; songs and I&#39;ve found one that I&#39;d like your opinion on.<br></p>
<p>PLEASE disregard the way the song is sung - very &quot;sweet&quot; and &quot;cute&quot; - and really unlike what Noel is teaching us.<br></p>
<p>The recordings have full orchestration and we would do them with just a piano accompaniment.<br></p>
<p>The first is a shorter version and sung very &quot;choral-y&quot;.  The second is sung in a style more in line with the lyrics (though both still sound &quot;sweet!&quot;), and is quite long, and I&#39;d likely cut some of it out.<br></p>
<p>Again, please let me know your thoughts.  Click on (or cut and paste)  each link, then click on the &quot;LISTEN&quot; button.<br></p>
<p>Version 1: (Vicky Tucker Courtney arrangement)</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527</a><br></p>
<p>Version 2: (Richard Kingsmore arrangement):</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262</a></p>
<p>And if you have any other suggestions for Palm Sunday songs - I&#39;m all ears!  I&#39;m looking at a few different versions of Holy! Holy! Holy!<br></p>
<p>For Good Friday it is very likely we will do Mozart&#39;s &quot;Ave Verum Copus&quot; (we&#39;ve sung it as &quot;Lead Us Heavenly Father&quot;).  What are your thoughts about singing it in Latin and displaying an English version of the words (which are NOT &quot;Lead us Heavenly Father!&quot;) on the monitor?  It is a classical piece written in Latin - but is singing it in Latin too Catholic for us at this time?<br></p>
<p>Thanks,</p>
<p>Barb<br></p>
<p>-- </p>
<p>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br>
 ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria</p>
<p>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.</p>
<p>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br>
 ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br></p>

I don&#39;t recommend that we try to fit the English words into the song, but I do like the idea of having the translation on the screen (as long as the translation isn&#39;t copyrighted). Otherwise it is just pretty music without any real meaning. </div><br><div class="gmail_quote"><div dir="ltr">On Wed, Jan 20, 2016 at 10:50 AM Barb Schenk &lt;<a href="mailto:barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com">barbara.ann.schenk@gmail.com</a>&gt; wrote:<br></div><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr">Thanks, Jon - What is your opinion on singing it in Latin?  It really isn&#39;t that hard to sing phonetically.  I have a few different translations (thanks for supplying yours!) and any one of them would be a bit awkward &quot;fitting&quot; the English text to the music - but we can absolutely do it if we think it&#39;s the better way to go.  I don&#39;t feel that the &quot;Lead us Heavenly Father&quot; words are nearly as appropriate for passion week.  Thanks!  Barb</div><div dir="ltr"><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Wed, Jan 20, 2016 at 7:11 AM, Jonathan White <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com" target="_blank">jonathan.jawhite@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 0.8ex;padding-left:1ex;border-left-color:rgb(204,204,204);border-left-width:1px;border-left-style:solid"><div dir="ltr">Good Morning Barb,<div><br></div><div>My preference is the Vicky Tucker Courtney arrangement. <p>Palm Sunday is always a difficult service to find songs for because the focus of Passion week is Good Friday and Easter.<br></p>
<p>So I&#39;ve been searching for contemporary &quot;Hosanna&quot; songs and I&#39;ve found one that I&#39;d like your opinion on.<br></p>
<p>PLEASE disregard the way the song is sung - very &quot;sweet&quot; and &quot;cute&quot; - and really unlike what Noel is teaching us.<br></p>
<p>The recordings have full orchestration and we would do them with just a piano accompaniment.<br></p>
<p>The first is a shorter version and sung very &quot;choral-y&quot;.  The second is sung in a style more in line with the lyrics (though both still sound &quot;sweet!&quot;), and is quite long, and I&#39;d likely cut some of it out.<br></p>
<p>Again, please let me know your thoughts.  Click on (or cut and paste)  each link, then click on the &quot;LISTEN&quot; button.<br></p>
<p>Version 1: (Vicky Tucker Courtney arrangement)</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/19831527</a><br></p>
<p>Version 2: (Richard Kingsmore arrangement):</p>
<p><a href="http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262" target="_blank">http://www.sheetmusicplus.com/title/hosanna-praise-is-rising-sheet-music/16557262</a></p>
<p>And if you have any other suggestions for Palm Sunday songs - I&#39;m all ears!  I&#39;m looking at a few different versions of Holy! Holy! Holy!<br></p>
<p>For Good Friday it is very likely we will do Mozart&#39;s &quot;Ave Verum Copus&quot; (we&#39;ve sung it as &quot;Lead Us Heavenly Father&quot;).  What are your thoughts about singing it in Latin and displaying an English version of the words (which are NOT &quot;Lead us Heavenly Father!&quot;) on the monitor?  It is a classical piece written in Latin - but is singing it in Latin too Catholic for us at this time?<br></p>
<p>Thanks,</p>
<p>Barb<br></p>

I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>

</div></blockquote></div>
</blockquote></div></div></div></div></div></blockquote></div></div></div></div>

<div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tomorrow&#39;s service.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-74c25eb4-5d5b-7813-0610-f6394455c476"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Wednesday, January 20th 2016</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Before Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H1; v. 1,2 - “Adoration”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Opening Hymn (Suggestion):</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H376 - “I Praise God’s Love in Adoration”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Text:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H98; v. 2 - “Blest Be the Tie that Binds”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Hymn of Repentance:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H271; v. 5 - “Break Thou the Bread of Life”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Communion Hymn:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H75 - “Blessed Assurance”</span></p></li></ul><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">After Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><span style="font-weight:400;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">H466; v. 3 - “Holy Spirit”</span></li></ul><div><br></div></span></div></div>

- used by the Germans during Hitler&#39;s time.  When we first got the Celebration hymnal and I was going to practice one of them maybe 7 or so years ago, Simone was pretty upset. <br><br></div><div>Things and attitudes may have changed since then.  So would you please reach out to Simone and get her take on it?  See if she&#39;s OK with it?  If not, then I would HIGHLY advise against using it.<br><br></div><div>Thanks!  Barb<br></div></div><div class="gmail_extra"><br><div class="gmail_quote">On Sat, Nov 14, 2015 at 9:16 AM, Jason Baisch <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:jason.baisch@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.baisch@gmail.com</a>&gt;</span> wrote:<br><blockquote class="gmail_quote" style="margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padding-left:1ex"><div dir="ltr">Hi Barb,<div>No problem, I&#39;ll send the note out.  Do you think we can go over C796 quickly on Monday?  It&#39;s a &quot;familiar&quot; </font><br clear="all"><br>-- <br></div><div class="gmail_signature">&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>

  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal" align="center"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">H396</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:24.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="33"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal" align="center"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3"> </font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:195.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="261"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;line-height:normal"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">The love of God</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td></tr><tr style="height:15pt"><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt;border-style:none solid solid;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext;padding:0in 5.4pt;width:58.25pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="78"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;line-height:normal"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">Close</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:41.25pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="55"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">

  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:24.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="33"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-align:center;line-height:normal" align="center"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3"> </font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td><td style="border-width:0px 1pt 1pt 0px;border-style:none solid solid none;border-color:rgb(0,0,0) windowtext windowtext rgb(0,0,0);padding:0in 5.4pt;width:195.75pt;height:15pt;background-color:transparent" nowrap valign="top" width="261"><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font><p style="margin:0in 0in 0pt;line-height:normal"><span style="color:black"><font face="Calibri" size="3">The Bridegroom comes</font></span></p><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">
  </font></td></tr></tbody></table><font face="Times New Roman" color="#000000" size="3">

</font></div></div><div dir="ltr"><div><br></div><div><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></blockquote></div>
</div></div></blockquote></div><br><br clear="all"><br>-- <br><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div>
</blockquote></div><p dir="ltr">Hey Barb,</p>
<p dir="ltr">We will be in Willow Grove tomorrow. I hope everything goes well. </p>
<p dir="ltr">See you on Wednesday!<br>
~Jon<br>
</p>

</font></div></div><div dir="ltr"><div><br></div><div><br>-- <br></div><div>&quot;My steps are ordered in my God&#39;s name. I move by divine programming. I meet the right people at the right time, get to the right place at the right time and do the right thing at the right time. I am bold to declare what I want and confidently reject what I dislike. My path is laced with grace as I move from glory to glory. I always have an unhindered access to whatever I need - resources, materials, information - everything...in my God&#39;s name&quot;  <br> ~ Oluwaseun Oguntuga, Lagos, Nigeria<br><br>HOPE:  The confident expectation of good things from God.<br><br>&#39;For I know the plans I have for you,&#39; says the Lord.  &#39;They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.  In those days when you pray, I will listen.  If you look for me wholeheartedly, you will find me.&#39;<br> ~ Jeremiah 29:11-13 – New Living Translation<br><br><br><br><br></div>
</div></blockquote></div><div dir="ltr">Hi Deacon Strobel,<div><br></div><div>I&#39;d like to order the following wireless HDMI for the TV upstairs:</div><div><a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00630WKGI?tag=thewire06-20&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;creative=374929&amp;camp=211189">http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00630WKGI?tag=thewire06-20&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;creative=374929&amp;camp=211189</a><br></div><div><br></div><div>The cost with tax will be $196.73.  This should allow Joachim to put powerpoint presentations of the text word and songs on the TV, as well as any other reference text words during service.</div><div><br></div><div>I will be measuring the stretch from the sacristy to the TV (through the attic) -- If the wireless solution doesn&#39;t work, the wired solution I found costs $315 (provided the distance is &lt;= 100 ft), but it is out of stock for the next 6 months. My hope is that the wireless option will work for us. Let me know what you think.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div></div><p dir="ltr"><br>

<div dir="ltr">Hi Everyone,<div><br></div><div>Here are the songs for tonight&#39;s word service.</div><div><br></div><div>Thanks!</div><div>~Jon</div><div><br></div><div><span id="docs-internal-guid-2574bed4-6b46-b358-1d21-9d994b95c10a"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:18.6667px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Wednesday, August 26th 2015</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);font-weight:700;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent">Before Service:</span></p><ul style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><li dir="ltr" style="list-style-type:disc;font-size:16px;font-family:Arial;color:rgb(0,0,0);vertical-align:baseline;background-color:transparent"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"><span style="vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap;background-color:transparent"> H293; style="font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;color:#000000;font-weight:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span style="font-weight:bold">Christmas Program</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Last Sunday School is December 20th (Christmas Program).</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Meredith could be giving birth right then (Jon to talk to her)</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Short &amp; Simple.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Don&#39;t have families bring their children on Sundays to practice.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Could do a sing along on the 20th.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Have a fellowship.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Doesn&#39;t have to be what Meredith normally puts together.</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Have Brunch</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span style="font-weight:bold"> </span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;height:11pt;direction:ltr"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;color:#000000;font-weight:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span style="font-weight:bold">Spring Fair</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Bouncy House, Food, Water -- Free to anyone who attends</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Invite people to come who wouldn&#39;t come if they had to pay</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Have other things for the community (3 Tables):</span></p><ul style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Raffle</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Selling something, but accessible</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Tag sale?</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Children&#39;s Crafts inside</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Have people inside who are willing to profess their faith -- Have booklets.</span></li></ul><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Something for everyone (Congregation pulls together -- all hands on deck)</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Go to playground -- Watch people on swings</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Interactive -- Not stuck in one place</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span>Iron out:</span></p><ul style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Is there going to be a beneficiary?</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>How are we going about advertising it?</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;direction:ltr"><span>Special invitation to a group?</span></li></ul><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;height:11pt;direction:ltr"><span></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:11pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;;line-height:1.0;direction:ltr"><span style="font-weight:bold">November: Plans for Sunday School - Instead of doing cookie bake, </span><span>they will invite children from the Coachman -- Come to WP along with Sunday School to participate in 2 Hour fellowship - Songs, Stories, Craft to bring home.</span></p></div></div></div><table style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse;" role="presentation"><tr><td style="padding: 0px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 3px;"
